title: Cuomo Probe Sparks Rift Over State Employees’ Legal Fees
sub_head: Gov. Hochul’s administration concludes the former  governor made invalid promise that New York state would cover legal fees of employees who testified in harassment probe
body:
When former New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo was under investigation last year for sexual harassment, his administration pledged to cover legal expenses for employees who testified in the probe. But the current administration has concluded the former governor’s promise was legally invalid, leaving a trail of unpaid legal bills hanging over state workers and their lawyers.
Now, state officials are trying to find a way out of the thicket, the latest fallout from a series of probes that culminated in Mr. Cuomo’s resignation.
